  • Single_Photons.SP module

Single_Photons.SP module¶

Underlying module consisting of all base functions controlling each feature of the hardware design

class SP_TOOLS¶

Bases: object

DD_idelay(channel, tap, stage)¶

Sets the input delay of the specified channel by configuring the delay line taps and the number of delay line stages to include

Parameters

  • channel (int) – Channel to delay (0-3)

  • tap (int) – Delay line tap (0-31)

  • stage (int) – Number of delay line stages (0-7)

TT_activate(time)¶

Sets the time out of the time tagger and pulls the time tagger out of reset, activating it

Parameters

time (float) – Time out in seconds

TT_proc()¶

Time tagger sampling process, waits until time tagger has data ready, then calculates time intervals for each channel from T0 and includes fine times and returns a time interval for each channel and which channels timed out.

Returns

dict – A dictionary containing time intervals (‘T1’…’T4’) and boolean time outs (‘T1s’…’T4s’)

TT_reset()¶

Puts time tagger into reset, stopping it

TT_set_timeout(timeval)¶

Set the time out of the time tagger

Parameters

timeval (float) – Time out in seconds

TT_wait_for_rdy()¶

Wait until time tagger tags each channel or times out (Hangs the thread)

__init__()¶

Initializes the hardware by first loading and configuring the FPGA with the hardware design and then by creating handles for each AXI GPIO block that allows connection from the processing system to the FPGA fabric.

calc_dc_lim(freq, dc)¶

Calculates the count value of the hardware counter where the output changes from high to low after this count value is passed by the hardware counter

Parameters

  • freq (float) – Frequency of the signal currently being emitted.

  • dc (float) – Duty cycle value (0-1)

Returns

int – Count value the hardware counter counts up to before switching the output signal from high to low.

calc_delay(delay)¶

Calculates the delay timer count value from a time in seconds

Parameters

delay (float) – Delay time in seconds

Returns

int – Count limit for delay timer

ct_arm_and_wait(first)¶

Arm two channel rising edge coincidence timer and hang until time data is ready (On channel 0 and 1)

Parameters

first (int) – Defines which channel to listen for start rising edge (0 or 1)

Returns

float – Time between rising edges (in seconds)

encode_phase_inc(freq)¶

Converts a supplied frequency to a phase increment amount that is supplied to the DDS modules to produce the necessary sine wave. Internally used function, should not be called directly.

Parameters

freq (float) – Frequency in Hz

Returns

  • list of float – 48 bit phase increment, first element is 32 bit LSB, second element is 16 bit MSB

  • float – is 32 bit LSB

  • float – is 16 bit MSB

pc_disable_channels(channels)¶

Disable counting on supplied channels

Parameters

channels (int) – Channels to disable counting on (binary encoded)

pc_enable_channels(channels)¶

Enable counting on supplied channels

Parameters

channels (int) – Channels to enable counting on (binary encoded)

pc_ex_trig_stop()¶

Enables and waits for the pulse counter to stop counting (based off when the stop signal is pulsed) and returns the counts for each channel.

Returns

list of int – Array of counts for each channel

pc_ex_triggered(window)¶

Start counting function for externally supplied start signal

Parameters

window (int) – Counting window (in seconds)

Returns

list of int – List of counts for each channel

pc_read_counts(channel)¶

Read counts on channel specified

Parameters

channel (int) – Channel to read counts of (0-3)

Returns

int – Number of counts

pc_set_window(window, channels)¶

Sets the pulse counter counting window period

Parameters

  • window (float) – Time to count for (in seconds)

  • channels (int) – Channels to count on (binary encoded)

pc_wait_for_rdy(channel, mode)¶

Hangs the thread until the counter has data ready to be acquired

Parameters

  • channel (int) – Channel to wait for

  • mode (int) – Mode of operation, 0 for fixed window mode, or 1 for external stop trigger mode

pg_disable()¶

Disable signal generator, holds the submodule in reset bringing all outputs low

pg_disable_channel(channel)¶

Disable specified channel, places channel into tristate high Z mode

Parameters

channel (int) – Channel to disable (0-3)

pg_enable()¶

Enables the signal generator, takes hardware submodule out of reset

pg_enable_channel(channel)¶

Enable specified channel, takes channel out of tristate high Z mode

Parameters

channel (int) – Channel to enable (0-3)

pg_set_channel_freq(channel, freq)¶

Sets the frequency of the specified channel

Parameters

  • channel (int) – Channel to set frequency of (0-3)

  • freq (float) – Frequency to set channel to (in Hz)

pg_set_dc(channel, dc)¶

Sets the duty cycle of the specified channel

Parameters

  • channel (int) – Channel to set the duty cycle of (0-3)

  • dc (float) – Duty cycle to set the specified channel to (0-1)

pg_set_delay(channel, delay)¶

Sets the delay of the specified channel

Parameters

  • channel (int) – Channel to set delay of (0-3)

  • delay (float) – The delay the specified channel is to be set to(in seconds)

pg_set_pw(channel, pw)¶

Sets the pulse width of the channel specified

Parameters

  • channel (int) – Channel to set pulse width of (0-3)

  • pw (float) – Pulse width to set channel to (in milliseconds)

st_arm_and_wait()¶

Arm single channel inter-rising_edge timer and hang until time data is ready to be acquired

Returns

float – Time between detected rising edges (in seconds)

uencode(val, length)¶

Calculates the number of binary ones in an integer of specified length

Parameters

  • val (int) – Arbitrary integer to get the number of binary ones from

  • length (int) – Length of the binary integer to include when counting up the ones.

Returns

int – The total number of ones within the binary length specified in the specified integer
